title: time
text: temporal functions aim complete missing time series data ensure functions like window functions like rolling averages auto regressive algebra #similar expand grid - expand.grid #algo infer missing dates timeseries # function !! df%>% dplyr::count(time,wt=col2)%>% dplyr::mutate(n-lag(n,1))%>%head(10) new_df%>% dplyr::count(time,wt=col2)%>% dplyr::mutate(n-lag(n,1))%>%head(10) #compare ggplot2::ggplot(df)+ ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(time,col2,col=col1))+ ggplot2::facet_wrap(~col1)+ ggplot2::theme_minimal() #â€¦ ggplot2::ggplot(new_df)+ ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(time,col2,col=col1))+ ggplot2::facet_wrap(~col1)+ ggplot2::theme_minimal() ```
code: library(RShinyHelpers) require(ggplot2) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #>  #> Attaching package: 'ggplot2' #> The following object is masked from 'package:crayon': #>  #>     %+%  require(dplyr) #> Loading required package: dplyr #> Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.1.2 #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union   # time series ts <-  as.Date("2022-01-03"):as.Date(Sys.Date()) ts <- sort(   as.Date(     ts[sample(c(TRUE,FALSE),size = 101,replace = TRUE,prob = c(0.7,0.3))],     origin='1970-01-01')   )   df <- data.frame(time=as.Date(ts),              col1=sample(replace=TRUE,letters[c(1:5)],size=length(ts)),              col2=sample(replace=TRUE,1:26,size=length(ts))              )  time_name <- sapply(df,class)[sapply(df,class)=='Date']%>%names()    new_df <- complete_time_factors(df)

code: require(ggplot2) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #>  #> Attaching package: â€˜ggplot2â€™ #> The following object is masked from â€˜package:crayonâ€™: #>  #>     %+% require(tibble) #> Loading required package: tibble require(dplyr) #> Loading required package: dplyr #> Warning: package â€˜dplyrâ€™ was built under R version 4.1.2 #>  #> Attaching package: â€˜dplyrâ€™ #> The following objects are masked from â€˜package:statsâ€™: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from â€˜package:baseâ€™: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # time series  ts <-  as.Date("2022-01-03"):as.Date(Sys.Date())  ts <- sort(    as.Date(      ts[sample(c(TRUE,FALSE),size = 101,replace = TRUE,prob = c(0.7,0.3))],      origin='1970-01-01')    )   df <- tibble::tibble(time=as.Date(ts),               col1=sample(replace=TRUE,letters[c(1:5)],size=length(ts)),               col2=sample(replace=TRUE,1:26,size=length(ts)),               )   time_name <- sapply(df,class)[sapply(df,class)=='Date']%>%names()    new_df <- complete_time_factors(df)    #similar to expand grid - but in expand.grid the  #algo does not infer missing dates from the timeseries # our function does !!    df%>%    dplyr::count(time,wt=col2)%>%    dplyr::mutate(n-lag(n,1))%>%head(10) #> # A tibble: 10 Ã— 3 #>    time           n `n - lag(n, 1)` #>    <date>     <int>           <int> #>  1 2022-01-04    21              NA #>  2 2022-01-05     8             -13 #>  3 2022-01-06    18              10 #>  4 2022-01-08     4             -14 #>  5 2022-01-10     8               4 #>  6 2022-01-12     8               0 #>  7 2022-01-13     4              -4 #>  8 2022-01-14    11               7 #>  9 2022-01-18     2              -9 #> 10 2022-01-19    10               8    new_df%>%    dplyr::count(time,wt=col2)%>%    dplyr::mutate(n-lag(n,1))%>%head(10) #>          time  n n - lag(n, 1) #> 1  2022-01-04 21            NA #> 2  2022-01-05  8           -13 #> 3  2022-01-06 18            10 #> 4  2022-01-07  0           -18 #> 5  2022-01-08  4             4 #> 6  2022-01-09  0            -4 #> 7  2022-01-10  8             8 #> 8  2022-01-11  0            -8 #> 9  2022-01-12  8             8 #> 10 2022-01-13  4            -4    #compare BEFORE and    ggplot2::ggplot(df)+  ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(time,col2,col=col1))+  ggplot2::facet_wrap(~col1)+  ggplot2::theme_minimal()     #... and after    ggplot2::ggplot(new_df)+  ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(time,col2,col=col1))+  ggplot2::facet_wrap(~col1)+  ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Themes a ggplot object â€” custom_theme
code: # if(!require(dplyr)){library(dplyr)} #if(!require(ggplot2)){library(ggplot2)}  mtcars <- dplyr::mutate(mtcars,am=as.factor(am)) ggplot_obj <-      ggplot2::ggplot( mtcars) +       ggplot2::facet_wrap(~am)+      ggplot2::labs(title = 'Graph Title')+      ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(disp,mpg,col=mpg))       ggplot_obj + custom_theme()

code: if(!require(dplyr)){library(dplyr)} edges <- data.frame(   to=sample(c('A','B','C','D'),size = 50,replace=TRUE),   from=sample(c('A','B','C','D','E','F'),size = 50,replace=TRUE))  dplyr::count(edges,to,from) #>    to from n #> 1   A    B 1 #> 2   A    C 2 #> 3   A    D 1 #> 4   A    F 2 #> 5   B    A 2 #> 6   B    B 1 #> 7   B    C 5 #> 8   B    D 1 #> 9   B    E 1 #> 10  B    F 1 #> 11  C    A 3 #> 12  C    B 2 #> 13  C    C 1 #> 14  C    D 4 #> 15  C    E 4 #> 16  C    F 1 #> 17  D    A 2 #> 18  D    B 3 #> 19  D    C 4 #> 20  D    E 4 #> 21  D    F 5  ordered = similar_permutations(edges,to,from)   dplyr::count(ordered, to ,from) #> # A tibble: 16 Ã— 3 #>    to    from      n #>    <chr> <chr> <int> #>  1 A     B         1 #>  2 A     C         2 #>  3 A     D         1 #>  4 A     F         2 #>  5 B     A         2 #>  6 B     C         5 #>  7 B     D         1 #>  8 C     A         3 #>  9 C     B         2 #> 10 C     D         4 #> 11 C     E         4 #> 12 D     A         2 #> 13 D     B         3 #> 14 D     C         4 #> 15 D     E         4 #> 16 D     F         5
